citation.article-title: Amycolatopsis echigonensis sp. nov. and Amycolatopsis niigatensis sp. nov., novel actinomycetes isolated from a filtration substrate
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Amycolatopsis niigatensis sp. nov.
Amycolatopsis niigatensis (ni.i.ga.ten′sis. N.L. fem. adj. niigatensis referring to Niigata Prefecture, Japan, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are aerobic, non-motile and Gram-positive and form a well-developed aerial and vegetative mycelium.
The aerial mycelium is white or light yellow; the vegetative mycelium is purple or purple–brown.
The temperature range for growth is 5–45 °C and the optimum temperature for growth is 30 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6–11 and the optimum is pH 9.
Acid is produced from d-galactose and l-rhamnose; no acid is produced from d-xylose, inositol or d-lactose; acid production for erythritol, d-adonitol and d-glucose is weak.

Using the API CORYNE and API ZYM systems, positive reactions are observed for pyrazinamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-galactosidase, urease, esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-glucosidase, alkaline phosphatase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-chymotrypsin and α-mannosidase.
No activity is detected for nitrate reductase, esterase (C4), α-galactosidase, lipase (C14) or α-fucosidase; gelatin hydrolysis and acid phosphatase are weak.
The predominant fatty acid is iso-C16 : 0.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 72.4 mol%.
The type strain is strain LC11T (=IAM 15388T =CCTCC AB206020T), which was isolated from a filtration substrate made from volcanic soil, Niigata, Japan.
